archimate:Device.name: Patrol Monitoring System – (PMS)
archimate:Device.documentation:
(For Security Department)
Intended Use:
To track, verify, and log security patrols across the hospital’s 163,000 sq ft, multi-building campus, ensuring that routine patrols, sensitive area checks, and emergency response protocols are followed consistently.
1. System Components
a. Guard Checkpoints (Tags or Beacons)
• Type: o RFID/NFC tags or BLE beacons placed at patrol points (doors, exits, critical zones) • Installation: o Tamper-resistant, mounted in fixed, discreet locations o Weather-resistant (for outdoor use), antimicrobial casings (for clinical areas) • Tag Type: o RFID/NFC: Passive, non-powered tags (durable, cost-effective) o BLE: Battery-powered beacon (for passive monitoring or proximity logging)
b. Patrol Reader Devices
• Device Type: o Handheld reader, rugged smartphone, or dedicated patrol device • Connectivity: o 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS o Offline capability with buffered sync • Data Capture: o Timestamp and checkpoint ID logging o QR code scan, photo capture, or incident logging • Form Factor: o Rugged, drop-resistant (IP65+, MIL-STD-810G) o Battery life ≥12 hours, USB-C charging • Authentication: o PIN or RFID badge login for accountability o biometric access
c. Charging & Sync Stations
• USB charging docks ( multi-bay) • Auto data sync via Wi-Fi/LAN when docked
2. Software Requirements
The infrastructure should support: • Real-time patrol logs • Missed patrol alerts • Route planning and checkpoint configuration • Incident tagging with photo/audio logs • Web dashboard access over LAN or cloud Ensure backend compatibility with hospital security servers or future cloud systems.
3. Network & Power Infrastructure
• Power: o 220–240V AC outlets for device charging stations at each guard post • Wi-Fi Coverage: o Full coverage in:  All building corridors, stairwells, entrances/exits  Roof access points, parking areas, and perimeter patrol paths  Basements, mechanical rooms, and restricted zones • Ethernet: o LAN ports at security offices for docking/syncing stations • Cabling: o Secure conduit for BLE beacon power (if hardwired), or ensure battery replacement access
4. Features
• Geo-fencing: o Patrols must occur within defined zones and times • SOS Button: o Emergency alert to security base when pressed • Tamper Alerts: o Notification if checkpoint tags or readers are damaged/removed • Two-way Messaging: o Dispatch can send instructions to patrol unit
5. Environmental Requirements
• Checkpoint Tags/Beacons: o IP65+ for outdoor/utility areas o Impact and disinfectant-resistant for clinical use • Devices: o Operating Temp: -10°C to 50°C o Shock/drop resistance to 4 ft+
